alert.note: Alert for Portage; Waupaca (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 6:04PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN PORTAGE AND WAUPACA COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM CDT... At 603 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Amherst, or 9 miles northwest of Waupaca, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Portage and Waupaca Counties, including the following locations... Fitzgerald Corners, Rural, Schmidt Corner, Lind Center, Northport, Emmons Creek Barrens, Scandinavia, Sheridan, Northland, and Nelsonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
